intro: Borreria verticillata var. brevifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved borreria, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, narrow leaves arranged in whorls around the stems. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, often displaying shades of white or pale pink. This variety is adapted to thrive in hot, dry environments, making it a hardy and resilient plant.
